intro: Noccaea rechingeri, commonly known as the alpine nailhead, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is native to the high mountain regions of Central Asia, including the Tibetan Plateau and the Himalayas. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers and its ability to thrive in cold, rocky environments. It typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and has a mat-forming growth habit. Noccaea rechingeri is adapted to harsh alpine conditions, with a short growing season and specialized mechanisms for water retention.
